title: Lewis Capaldi trolls Niall Horan as they reveals how pair became pals
text:
Niall and Lewis have both helped each other out with their music…

Niall Horan and Lewis Capaldi have spoken out about their friendship in a new video, with Niall explaining how he helped the Someone You Loved singer early in his career.

Explaining how the pair met as part of a video testing their friendship on Glamour, Niall explained: ‘We met on social media, I slid into his DMs.

‘My cousin showed me his music online when he had a very small amount of views on a Vevo video.’

Lewis, meanwhile, had different ideas about how they met, trolling the singer by claiming: ‘I was already established as an artist. I was already smashing it in the charts, tickets flying off the shelves.

‘[Niall] said to me, “Lewis I’m releasing my new album, I’m struggling to find my own feet as a solo artist. Obviously you seem to be doing such a good job. You’re the best solo artist in the world.”

‘There’s my wing, he’s under it…’

We can only assume that Lewis is the one joking here, but you never know…

The pair explained how they bond over ‘heavy, copious amounts of alcohol…’ and both had compliments for each other.

Lewis called Niall ‘a good kid with a kind heart’, while Niall said on Lewis: ‘He’s the funniest person I know… I’m so proud of him’.

‘My music was doing f*ck all, and he was one of the first people to reach out and say ‘love your music’…’ Lewis added.

The two singers have previous spoken about how they listen to each other’s music, with Niall – who recently released new song Nice To Meet Ya – revealing that he often shares his new music with Lewis before it’s released to get his very honest opinion.

‘Lewis has got a really good ear and obviously I mean, the guy’s got hits coming out of his ears, but he’s got a really similar type thing so I’ll always play them to him. He really likes the new one actually, ‘coz he’s a bit of a scally isn’t he?’ he told Capital FM last week.

Niall added that Lewis is always good for honest feedback: ‘Yeah, that’s what you want.

‘You don’t want anyone messing around, because you could completely lie to someone but there’s no point in that because I suppose as friends they would have my best interests at heart.’
